channel.title: 1000$ Investment
channel.description:
Okay heres the story guys, my parents will NOT give me money for a car.
And i already have about 1k ready to invest in something to get at least 5k for a reliable car in a short amount of time.
Does anyone have any advice on this? And btw im trying to do it over the summer time.

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

Mopar know’s what he’s talking about when it comes to cars, believe… everything.

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“M1tch3ll, post:33, topic:399674”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=496805.msg3632843#msg3632843 date=1308365032]
What makes you think you need $5000 for a car? Buy a car for $1000, and learn valuable skills like how to work on cars. (but really, you should be able to get a decent running car for $1000 nowadays)
[/quote]

Uhh ohh… You’ll get piece of crap for 1000$.

I like my choice the best ;D

I’ve got 8000€(1$ = 0.7€) banked, going to buy 1990 Mercedes Benz 190e 2.5l Cosworth for 4000-6000€. It’s pretty much cheap equal to new BMW (2.5l Cosworth engine with turbo should produce 240-250hp STOCK and getting power out of Cosworth engine is easy, could easily make it past 400hp (see: new BMW is 270-320hp and the MB 190e is better looking too)[/quote]

Looks like you are going to get a piece of crap for 4000-6000€ hehe. My car came stock with 425hp, and 425ft/lbs of torque too, no turbo.

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

marcbob:

My parents invest money with some people, and the people they invest with had a party at their house and I went. It was a fun party and they were showing the kids there these programs. According to them, at my age if I invest around $1200, it will turn into one million by the time I am 69. (hehe 69 but that was the number) Look into real investor shit and you probably can find better stuff.

I don’t see how they can tell you what an investment will turn into With the exception, of course, of insider trading.

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @M1tch3ll M1tch3ll
item.description:
@M1tch3ll wrote:

Moparisthebest:

What makes you think you need $5000 for a car? Buy a car for $1000, and learn valuable skills like how to work on cars. (but really, you should be able to get a decent running car for $1000 nowadays)

Uhh ohh… You’ll get piece of crap for 1000$.

I like my choice the best ;D

I’ve got 8000€(1$ = 0.7€) banked, going to buy 1990 Mercedes Benz 190e 2.5l Cosworth for 4000-6000€. It’s pretty much cheap equal to new BMW (2.5l Cosworth engine with turbo should produce 240-250hp STOCK and getting power out of Cosworth engine is easy, could easily make it past 400hp (see: new BMW is 270-320hp and the MB 190e is better looking too)

For the money making… I’ve got two ‘interesting’ ways.

  1. RSPS programming (make server yourself or program for others, easily 65$ p/h when you keep prices low and work fast)
  2. Massive bot army in RuneScape (3 to 5 bots per vps, 25+ vps, one bot makes 200-300K gold p/h, sell gold at 0,5$/1m gp. My profit calculation:
    3 bots per vps X (amount of vps here, I have 25) X (how much gold they make p/h, I make 200k) X 24(hours p/day) X 30(days p/month) X (gold sell price, I sell 0,6$/m) then minus the costs.

Remember: You must round the amount of gold to millions before multiplying it with sell price.

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:16, topic:399674”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=496805.msg3632843#msg3632843 date=1308365032]
What makes you think you need $5000 for a car? Buy a car for $1000, and learn valuable skills like how to work on cars. (but really, you should be able to get a decent running car for $1000 nowadays)
[/quote]
Yeah i suppose but buying a 1000$ car will just cause more expenses and very time consuming to work from.[/quote]
It will not be more expensive, it will be far cheaper in the long run. You might spend slightly more time working on a $1000 car as opposed to a $5000 one, but then again since you are asking for advice on here, you are like me and obviously have more time than money.

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:23, topic:399674"]Buy loads of stuff from China, and put up a website, advertise and you’ll get huge profit. Scooter parts are great for this kinda thing, for example cylinders are like 1.5$ each if you buy with 1k+, and the price you see in websites selling them is usually about 40$-50$. and since chinese scooters are shit, people will keep buying new cylinders and other parts.

You can always buy loads of trash from there too, like lighters, toys, etc and put them on sale, there’s loads of things you can do.[/quote]
not such a plausible idea for his financial state…

Read full topic

item.title: 1000$ Investment
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Buy loads of stuff from China, and put up a website, advertise and you’ll get huge profit. Scooter parts are great for this kinda thing, for example cylinders are like 1.5$ each if you buy with 1k+, and the price you see in websites selling them is usually about 40$-50$. and since chinese scooters are shit, people will keep buying new cylinders and other parts.

You can always buy loads of trash from there too, like lighters, toys, etc and put them on sale, there’s loads of things you can do.
